full_outline:
Act 1: Jane is a talented but unrecognized writer at a publishing house. She discovers a rejected manuscript and secretly revises it.

Act 2: Jane pitches the manuscript as her discovery of a new author. As the book gains popularity, Jane struggles with guilt. After learning the original author died, Jane falls into depression. Her success feels hollow.

Act 3: Jane realizes she must come clean. At her award acceptance speech, she confesses the truth about the manuscript. Though she loses her job, she begins writing her own authentic work.
designated_beat: Jane realizes she must come clean. At her award acceptance speech, she confesses the truth about the manuscript.
